title: SolrCLI still mentions managed_schema_configs as valid config option for SolrCloud example
description: SolrCLI still mentions managed_schema_configs as valid config option for the SolrCloud example. It should be removed as an option to avoid giving a bad out-of-box experience.

comments.author: ASF subversion and git services
comments.content:
Commit 812f7b059c2169ab52e71622edb0b4a50603ae32 in lucene-solr's branch refs/heads/jira/SOLR-9007 from Timothy Potter
[ https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=lucene-solr.git;h=812f7b0 ]

SOLR-9007: remove mention of managed_schema_configs

comments.author: ASF subversion and git services
comments.content:
Commit 9d0da3156cc2b494ad65686efa2b749b35dd2a25 in lucene-solr's branch refs/heads/master from Timothy Potter
[ https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=lucene-solr.git;h=9d0da31 ]

SOLR-9007: remove mention of managed_schema_configs

comments.author: Shawn Heisey
comments.content: Was the creation of the jira/SOLR-9007 branch on the central repo intentional?  It was committed to master a few minutes later, so it seems like it may have been accidental.

comments.content:

comments.author: Shawn Heisey
comments.content:
If you meant to do it, then there's no issue.

Just struck me as a little odd to create a branch if changes will be immediately committed to master.

comments.author: Timothy Potter
comments.content: meh branches are cheap in git ... it's deleted now anyway
